quest.name: Camp Broken Engines
journal:
 Quest Sync
Rimelnaud perhaps requires some thawing.

Upon significant prompting from Rimelnaud, Appius mentions that a replacement carburetor will be required to fix one of the camp's ceruleum engines. You agree to head to Monitoring Station G in order to extract one from an engine there.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.
You search ceruleum engine innards as instructed, and come up with what is, as far as you can tell, an intact carburetor.

Appius wastes no time in repairing the ceruleum engines, and it soon transpires that he is originally from the area currently occupied by the camp. He explains that his motivation for reactivating the platform is to make returning to the area a viable proposition for those who once inhabited it, and is naturally delighted when Rimelnaud promises to broach the topic with his superior.
objectives: Deliver the ceruleum engine carburetor to Appius.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Now that Rimelnaud knows I'm worthy of his trust, we need only prove it to his superiors!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Ere you become even more excited─will you indeed require additional parts to perform your repairs? I cannot say I spotted any likely spares while setting up the camp...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Ah, it's so good to have a quick-thinking machinist like yourself on my side!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: No amount of flattery will convince me to take you to my superiors ere we have physical proof of your good intentions.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Now focus, please. Are spare parts required─yes or no?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. You're awfully tense about the shoulders, did you know that?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: I will be needing a replacement carburetor for one of the engines. Fortunately, the same sort of engines were in use at Monitoring Station G, last I checked. We ought to be able to find what we need there.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: After I've swapped out the faulty part and made my other repairs, I'll warm the engines up properly. That should clear any ceruleum residue and allow them to run at full capacity once more.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: With that in mind, I want to start taking things apart. Can you fetch the carburetor for me? Do you even know what a carburetor is?

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: She'sHe's a bona fide hero, you know! You can't just ask herhim to do your bidding. And rudely, at that!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No idea, but leave it to me.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm used to being ordered around...

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: If you're certain... You will need to look for a sort of tube connected to the ceruleum engine's core. Many magitek devices utilize them.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: No, no, it's “car-bur-e-tor.” Carburetor!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Never fear─I shall keep an eye on Appius.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This so-called “carburetor” appears to have seen better days. Perhaps another ceruleum engine has a nicer one.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This “carburetor” appears to be intact. Appius will know for certain.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: And not a moment too soon! Were you able to find an intact carburetor?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: This will do it! Now Rimelnaud and I can finish fixing up those engines in no time at all.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: There─everything's in order. These should be much more efficient...and you'll notice they've stopped making strange and ominous noises!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I must say, I am taken aback by your abundance of skill. Allow me to thank you on behalf of everyone here at Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Oh, the pleasure's all mine. Happy to be of service!

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: You...do seem genuine about that. Tell me, do you have some sort of connection to Camp Broken Glass?

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: In a way... I hail from Laterum, as it happens.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: It was a village here─precisely where your camp is now. It acted as a checkpoint for those visiting the capital, but it was also home to the rigs' workers and our families.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Obviously, much has happened since last I could call this place “home,” but in my heart of hearts, it always will be.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: I must apologize. We're effectively occupying your home, yet placed the full burden of proving good faith in our dealings upon you...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Oh, no, I couldn't blame you for that. We hardly had a viable alternative to abandoning Laterum, knowing we could never defend ourselves against wandering bands of maddened soldiers, but that reality is no more your fault than ours.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Even if you vacated right this instant, I doubt many of us would return. We simply don't have the resources...

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Until Juturna Platform G is back in working order, that is.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Truth be told, your presence here is what has me daring to hope. If you agree to help me now, there may come a day when the other survivors and I can come home.

dialogue.name: RIMELNAUD
dialogue.text: Fury above, I certainly can't turn you away now...and you've proven yourself with your work this day. I've no lingering qualms about approaching my superiors with your proposal.

dialogue.name: APPIUS
dialogue.text: Truly? Oh, I could kiss you!
